info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mecklenburg County through 1130 PM EDT... At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clover, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chase City around 1115 PM EDT. Boydton around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Fairview, Rogers Corner, Spanish Grove, Richardson, Finchley, John H Kerr Reservoir, Baskerville, Skipwith and Wightman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
